newsitem.title: GERMANY: Strikes, bad weather hit Lufthansa December number.
newsitem.headline: Strikes, bad weather hit Lufthansa December number.

text.p: Strikes and bad weather caused a 1.2 percent drop in Deutsche Lufthansa AG passenger numbers to 2.2 million in December, the airline's investor relations department said.
The airline's passenger load factor rose 1.8 percentage points year-on-year to 63.9 percent in December, the latest monthly traffic report said.
"The warning strike staged by the DAG white collar workers' union led not only to cancellation of a number of flights but also to many passngers switching to other airlines," the report said.
Flight operations were severely disrupted by wintry weather at the end of the month, it added.
Jet fuel prices in December were still about 50 percent up on the previous year which generated substantial additional costs, Lufthansa said.
Holiday airline Condor increased passenger numbers 11 percent to 355,000 in December and regional subsidiary Lufthansa Cityline saw a 17.8 percent rise to 221,000 passesngers.
The Lufthansa group increased overall passenger numbers 1.5 percent to 2.84 million and improved its load factor by 1.9 percentage points to 65.4 percent.
